channel.title: Barnum Effect - Radio Comedy
channel.itunes:subtitle: radio sketch just for you
channel.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
channel.itunes:summary: Barnum Effect is radio comedy for people with tote bags. Produced by Lila Newman and Sarah Rosenshine.
channel.description: Barnum Effect is radio comedy for people with tote bags. Produced by Sarah Rosenshine and Lila Newman.

item.title: Mini-Episode
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: We're in between episodes! In the meantime, here's a mini. Written and performed by Dave Franklin, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Ben Mizel, Sarah Rosenshine, and Lila Newman
item.itunes:summary: We're in between episodes! In the meantime, here's a mini. Written and performed by Dave Franklin, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Ben Mizel, Sarah Rosenshine, and Lila Newman.

item.title: The Thanksgiving Episode
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: Lexi Ann, Robbie, Sport, and special guest Emma West (New Disruptors) talk about the 57th episode of Lyfe's Buffet: Canadian Thankin'. Written and performed by Barnum Effect, with special guests Serena Berman, Isaac Jay, and Emily Loughlin.
item.itunes:summary: Lexi Ann, Robbie, Sport, and special guest Emma West (New Disruptors) talk about the 57th episode of Lyfe's Buffet: Canadian Thankin'. Written and performed by Barnum Effect, with special guests Serena Berman, Isaac Jay, and Emily Loughlin.

item.title: Episode 11
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: A merger between American Airlines and Live Fantasies, Game of Thrones watching gets tense, and a trip to the Renaissance Faire. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Ben Mizel, Aaron Horton, and Dave Franklin.
item.itunes:summary: A merger between American Airlines and Live Fantasies, Game of Thrones watching gets tense, and a trip to the Renaissance Faire. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Ben Mizel, Aaron Horton, and Dave Franklin.

item.title: Episode 10
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: Rocky and Wildcat face off on Survival Team, Michelangelo debates his artistic choices, and a trip to Sea World. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Gil Newman, Ben Mizel, Aaron Horton, and Dave Franklin.
item.itunes:summary: Rocky and Wildcat face off on Survival Team, Michelangelo debates his artistic choices, and a couple takes a trip to Sea World. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Gil Newman, Ben Mizel, Aaron Horton, and Dave Franklin.

item.title: Episode 8
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: The most recent episode of the game show 'Thing Or No Thing' and an ad for tea. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Aaron Horton, Ben Mizel, Alyssa Lott, and Dave Franklin.
item.itunes:summary: The most recent episode of the game show 'Thing Or No Thing', Michelle from Discover Fraud Services makes some discoveries, and an ad for tea. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Aaron Horton, Ben Mizel, Alyssa Lott, and Dave Franklin.

item.title: Episode 7
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: A chance encounter at a club turns out unexpectedly, America tries a new strategy at Camp David, and a trip to Mars. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Ben Mizel, Aaron Horton, and Dave Franklin.
item.itunes:summary: A chance encounter at a club turns out unexpectedly, America tries a new strategy at Camp David, and a trip to Mars. Written and performed by Lila Newman, Sarah Rosenshine, Kelsey Glass-Johnston, Ben Mizel, Aaron Horton, and Dave Franklin.

item.title: Episode 5
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: Some friends wait for Marjorie to arrive at lunch, an HR rep announces a new floorplan, and a school tries a new Sex Ed tactic.

item.title: Episode 3
item.itunes:author: Barnum Effect
item.itunes:subtitle: The host of The Table has an off night, the Grim Reaper releases a book of essays, and Kermit sings a tune for the little ones.

item.title: Episode 1

item.itunes:subtitle: A couple discovers the majesty of nature while on their honeymoon, the post-season pre-finale of Fashion Inferno pre-premieres, and a family shares their thoughts about people in comedy.

item.itunes:subtitle: The introduction of the 2014 Quasi Moto, some sound editors have a heart-to-heart, and an elderly woman writes to People Magazine.
